page.title: 11MARS FACTORY
page.content: In 1932, a young American, Forrest E. Mars, arrived in Europe.He had some capital but, even more important,he had the recipe for a new chocolate bar which he had developed with his father.Forrest Mars decided that Slough was the best place to set up business. The Mars bar was very successful and by the end of the year over one hundred people worked in the Dorset Avenue factory. At the start it was not unusual to work eighty hours a week.You needed no qualifications,but you had to be over seventeen. Mars today makes over 20 brands of sweets.Approximately 3000 people work for Mars.Mars is the largest chocolate factory in th U.K. and 1 of the 3 top confectionary companies.It has earned Slough the title of{"The Confectionary {Capital of Europe". }
